intro: Artemisia elatior, commonly known as tall wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its gray-green, aromatic foliage and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Artemisia elatior is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
